Liverpool plot £10m bid for Nottingham Forest whizkid Ben Brereton after scouts rave about the striker 
Jurgen Klopp believes he can turn the 17-year-old into a Premier League star By Alan Nixon Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LIVERPOOL are keen to sign Nottingham Forest striker Ben Brereton — and mould him into a future Kop No 9. 
Anfield spies have been raving about the young forward, who will be 18 next month. Getty Images Ben Brereton is a rising star at Nottingham Forest and Jurgen Klopp wants him at Anfield Liverpool 3-1 Arsenal : Liverpool down Gunners after Sanchez is dropped 
Boss Jurgen Klopp knows the Reds do not have a rising star in their striking ranks and he fancies taking Brereton under his wing and developing his talent. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Liverpool news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Brereton has shown his quality with three goals and clever assists since being thrown into the Forest first team in January to help manager Gary Brazil’s Championship struggle. 
The former Stoke kid has the kind of skills Klopp thinks he can use to make him a modern forward, playing the way the German coach wants. And Liverpool would like to buy him to keep rather than loan the player back to Forest because Klopp likes to work on players inside his own set-up. Forest would be looking for about £10million for Brereton — a figure that would not scare off Liverpool. 
Meanwhile, the City Ground outfit want to give Dani Pinillos a new deal to stop him leaving on a free. 
They have started talks with the Spanish left-back, who is back from a long injury lay-off. 
And former Anfield keeper Brad Jones hopes to return to England after starring in Holland for Feyenoord. 
The Aussie — who turns 35 next week — is out of contract this summer.
